<<<api>>>: SQLiteDatabase.query
<<<code>>>: In your MainActivity class, you can connect to your AdapterClass by creating an instance of it and calling its methods. Here's an example:

public class LoginActivity extends Activity {
    EditText nameText, phoneText;
    Button registeredButton, newUser;
    AdapterClass adapter;

    @Override
    protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
        super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
        setContentView(R.layout.login);

        newUser = (Button) findViewById(R.id.new_user);
        nameText = (EditText) findViewById(R.id.user_text);
        phoneText = (EditText) findViewById(R.id.pass_text);

        adapter = new AdapterClass(getApplicationContext(), DatabaseDetail.REGISTER);
        adapter.Open();

        newUser.setOnClickListener(new View.OnClickListener() {
            @Override
            public void onClick(View v) {
                String name = nameText.getText().toString();
                String phone = phoneText.getText().toString();

                Cursor cursor = adapter.query("CUS_NAME=? AND CUS_PHONE=?", new String[]{name, phone});
                startManagingCursor(cursor);
                cursor.moveToFirst();

                if (cursor.getCount() > 0) {
                    Toast.makeText(getApplicationContext(), "Success", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show();
                } else {
                    // Handle failure case
                }
            }
        });
    }
}

public class AdapterClass {
    private SQLiteDatabase database;

    public AdapterClass(Context context, String databaseName) {
        database = context.openOrCreateDatabase(databaseName, Context.MODE_PRIVATE, null);
    }

    public void Open() {
        // Open the database connection
    }

    public Cursor query(String selection, String[] selectionArgs) {
        return database.query("CUS_REGISTER", null, selection, selectionArgs, null, null, null);
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In your MainActivity class, you create an instance of AdapterClass and call its Open() method to open the database connection. Then, in the onClick() method of the newUser button, you call the query() method of the adapter to perform the database query. The result is stored in a Cursor object, which you can then use to check if any records were returned.
